snippet: Fissures are forming as Prime Minister David Cameron of Britain expresses increasing skepticism of the value of European Union inclusion.
abstract: Tensions rise as Germany and Britain clash over who should next lead European Union; German Chancellor Angela Merkel backs Jean-Claude Juncker to be new president of European Commission, EU's powerful administrative arm, but British Prime Min David Cameron believes Juncker will only make EU seem even more removed from its citizens; also makes it clear that his promotion will hasten Britain's departure from the bloc.
lead_paragraph: Fissures are forming as Prime Minister David Cameron of Britain expresses increasing skepticism of the value of European Union inclusion.

headline.main: Merkel Cites ‘Threats’ in Warning to Cameron
headline.print_headline: Tensions Rise as Germany and Britain Clash on E.U.
